org.kepler.reporting.gui

Class ReportDesignerPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.kepler.reporting.gui.ReportDesignerPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, StateChangeListener, TabPane

    public class ReportDesignerPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements TabPane, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener, StateChangeListener, java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener
    This class creates a gui pane the allows users to create a report layout for a Kepler Workflow. It implements TabPane, which is an extension point for additional tabbed contents in the Kepler gui. See TabPane for more details.
    Author:
    staggs created January 7, 2009
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                               Item associtem,
                               DragAndDropPanel panel)
        addDeleteButton() adds the delete button to the toolbar. there is also an 'Open ROML' button that is commented out, but can be uncommented if necessary for testing purposes. Note: 'Open ROMl' works with a test class located in org.kepler.reporting.rio.test ReportTest.java

      • renderStaticReportItem

        public DragAndDropPanel renderStaticReportItem(Item tmpItem)
        renderStaticReportItem() - Renders the Static Report Items
        Parameters:
        tmpItem -
        Returns:
        DragAndDropPanel columnPanel Note: there is a reason that these are called 'columPanel', this is because in the Report model these panels represent the last nested element in the report that represents a 'column'. Even though we don't have multiple column layouts in this release.
